# GitHub Copilot Instructions

- Code must be terse, simple, and highly readable.
- Prefer clarity over cleverness. KISS principle always.
- Avoid unnecessary abstraction or complexity.
- Use descriptive names, minimal comments.
- No unused code or features.
- Code should be idiomatic to the language/framework.
- Follow established project conventions and styles.
- Ensure code is well-tested with unit/integration tests.
- Look at `README.md`, `ARCHITECTURE.md`, and existing code for context.
- Ask for clarification if requirements are unclear.
